Subjective: Spot on neck x 2 weeks. Started as small wound after shaving, also possible insect bite. Initially thought wart. Now swollen, redder. Intermittent scabbing/flaking. Itches. No pain. No other similar spots. PMH: Warts, ear abscess removal. FH: Paternal family hx of sun-related skin problems (grandfather, uncles), specific diagnosis unknown. Concern: Skin cancer after online search. Request: Wants lesion identified and removed; prefers freezing.
Objective: Skin (Neck): Single raised, pinkish-red lesion, ~0.5 cm, with a redder spot in the center. No visible scab or flaking on exam. Remainder of neck exam shows some freckles only. Lymph: No cervical lymphadenopathy.
Assessment: Uncertain skin lesion, neck. Differential diagnosis includes pyogenic granuloma vs. atypical mole. Awaiting dermatology assessment.
Plan: Teledermatology consult: Will send photos to dermatologist for opinion.
Discussed potential removal options: cryotherapy (freezing), excision, or shave/curettage for histology.
Patient expressed preference for cryotherapy if appropriate.
Follow-up: Will call patient on Friday (before 10 AM or after 3 PM) with dermatologist's advice. Authorized to leave voicemail if unavailable.
